Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if that is needed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: updated my KMD, ILN and NSPV fullnodes with latest version

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think we should move teh fetch of the headers to a seperate API in the daemon. This should make it reasonably easy.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Currently it only fetches between 2 notarizations so if you cant scan forwards because it doesnt exist yet. So the notarizations should just be returned then those 2 heights used to call a function for headers

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That may change a bit much stuff though ü§î

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: getinfo has an optional hdrheight parameter

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can query for individual header

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why not use that?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is actually more efficient to do 10 smaller tx than one big one, due to packet switching characteristics

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think a single getinfo might actually fit into a single tcp/ip packet, but not sure

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: IUt will use lots of nodes aswell and spread it around

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, it is better to request headers one at a time

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its constantly getting sent them by all nodes. So really in not much time of being online it has almost enough headers received, just doesnt save them anywhere

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Should be enough to just check the previous header and save them back to he last notarizatrion

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, just storing the most recent 100 headers will be enough in 99.9% of cases

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just rotate the buffer and request any that are missing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any new block should just connect right up to the chain tip to become the new chaintip

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in case of reorg, then might need to wait for notarization to resolve things, as longest chain will be fighting each other until we get a notarization

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmm yes, it currently wouldnt go backwards lol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, it is quite primitive

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I mean as long as the chain is still moving, it would eventually be ok...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess maybe reorg handling would be good, ie. if a longer chain comes in, then need to request the missing headers until it connects to the notarized chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but yes the  headers it has would then be wrong. and need to be checked

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think that is all that needs to be done. so if a new longer chain arrives that doesnt connect, then query the prior heights to fill in the missing headers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or can rely on reorgs being rare enough, to just clear the entire cache if it is detected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then scanning back to the notarization will automatically fill it with the valid headers

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That might be a lot easier, not that the chain tip is that imporant, most utxos are actually notarised
